title: 2001 Mars Odyssey
subtitle: Mars orbiter â€¢ global mapping & relay

stages.name: Launch
stages.text: 2001 Mars Odyssey launched aboard a Delta II rocket from Cape Canaveral on a seven-month cruise to Mars.

media.caption: Delta II launch carrying 2001 Mars Odyssey (PIA20331).

stages.name: Mars orbit insertion
stages.text: After its cruise, Odyssey fired its main engine for Mars Orbit Insertion (MOI) and was captured into orbit around Mars.

media.caption: Artist's concept of Mars Odyssey in orbit (PIA04244).

stages.name: First THEMIS image
stages.text: During early orbital checkout, the THEMIS instrument returned its first thermal-infrared temperature image of Mars, demonstrating day/night surface-temperature mapping.

media.caption: First THEMIS thermal-infrared image of Mars (PIA03459).

stages.name: Science mapping begins
stages.text: Odyssey began its primary science mapping campaign as instruments were turned toward Mars and initial calibration and data acquisition commenced.

media.caption: Neutron spectrometer hydrogen map derived from the first months of mapping (PIA03800).
media.credit: NASA/JPL/University of Arizona/Los Alamos National Laboratories

stages.name: Hydrogen (water-ice indicator) mapped
stages.text: Early mapping with the gamma-ray and neutron instruments revealed widespread near-subsurface hydrogen, strongly indicating water ice in polar regions and guiding later landing-site and climate studies.

media.caption: Global map of epithermal neutrons showing hydrogen-rich regions (PIA03800).
media.credit: NASA/JPL/University of Arizona/Los Alamos National Laboratories
